meanings: unemployed person, jobless person, (집합적) the unemployed, the jobless

examples.korean: For many kids leaving college the prospect of unemployment beckons. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 많은 대졸자들을 향해 실업의 가능성이 손짓을 하고 있다[많은 대졸자가 실업자가 될 가능성이 크다.] Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: For many kids leaving college the prospect of unemployment beckons. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Groups of unemployed people from all over the country marched in procession to the capital. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 전국 각지에서 모인 실업자 단체들이 행렬을 이뤄 수도로 행진했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Groups of unemployed people from all over the country marched in procession to the capital. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: I’ve joined the ranks of the unemployed. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 나는 실업자 대열에 합류했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I’ve joined the ranks of the unemployed. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: a growing militancy amongst the unemployed 듣기 Add to Wordbook 실업자들 사이에서 커져 가는 공격성 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: He’s been out of a job for six months now. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그는 이제 실업자가 된 지 6개월째이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
